page.title: 18Ludlow Hunt,Ashford C.
page.content: The fox-hounds are born at the kennels and at the age of 12 weeks are sent to farms where they spend their first year.After a year on a farm the young fox-hounds return to the kennels for training.They have a working life of about 6 years.There are also 8 Jack Russell terriers at the kennels which are used to follow the fox down a hole where the hounds cannot go.The Hunt meets at 11a.m. and has as many as 40 riders on a weekend meet and may hunt all day,depending upon when they find a fox.The hounds rely on their strong sense of smell to track a fox and can cover a distance of 40 miles in one day.The kennel huntsman exercises the hounds daily and they are fed fresh meat.
